revised_title: Properties of Gold-Silver Alloys and Their Implications for Coinage
tldr: This study investigates the properties of gold-silver alloys and their implications for coinage standards. The authors find that gold-silver alloys are isomorphous and that their freezing point depression follows a straight line. They also observe that the alloys have a fine-grained structure and recommend using silver as the alloying metal for trial plates in the coinage process.
